lessons: Geographical conditions and the course of history

questions.question: Which factor among the pillars of history directly connects history with geography?
questions.answer: Place

questions.question: Which aspect of human life is most directly affected by the availability of fertile land?
questions.answer: Diet

questions.question: Why is life in hilly regions described as more strenuous than in plains?

options.text: Due to lack of fertile land

questions.answer: Due to lack of fertile land

questions.question: Which activity forms a major source of food in hilly regions as described in the chapter?
questions.answer: Hunting and gathering

questions.question: Which condition leads to the development of villages and towns over time?
questions.answer: Abundance of means of living

questions.question: Which of the following can cause settlements to become deserted?
questions.answer: Environmental degradation

questions.question: Which natural feature lies to the north of India?
questions.answer: Himalayas

questions.question: Which seas and oceans surround India on three sides?

options.text: Arabian Sea, Indian Ocean, Bay of Bengal
Red Sea, Arabian Sea, Bay of Bengal
Indian Ocean, Red Sea, Pacific Ocean
Bay of Bengal, Pacific Ocean, Arabian Sea

questions.answer: Arabian Sea, Indian Ocean, Bay of Bengal

questions.question: Which regions were included in ancient India before 1947?
questions.answer: India, Pakistan and Bangladesh

questions.question: Which mountain ranges formed a natural barrier to the north of the Indian subcontinent?
questions.answer: Hindukush and Himalaya

questions.question: Which passes provided land routes into ancient India?
questions.answer: Khyber and Bolan

questions.question: Why was the Silk Route important in ancient times?

options.text: It was used mainly for religious travel
It facilitated trade of silk to western countries

questions.answer: It facilitated trade of silk to western countries

questions.question: Which rivers form the plains important to early Indian civilization?
questions.answer: Sindhu, Ganga, Brahmaputra

questions.question: What type of landform is India described as due to being surrounded by sea on three sides?
questions.answer: Peninsula

questions.question: Which plateau occupies a major part of the Indian peninsula?
questions.answer: Deccan Plateau

questions.question: Which mountain ranges lie to the north of the Deccan Plateau?
questions.answer: Vindhya and Satpuda

questions.question: What are the Western Ghats also known as?
questions.answer: Sahyadri Range

questions.question: Which regions lie to the west of the Sahyadri mountains?
questions.answer: Konkan and Malabar

questions.question: Which empire included the Deccan Plateau as part of its territory?
questions.answer: Maurya Empire

questions.question: Why were coastal regions important in ancient India?

options.text: They enabled sea trade with western countries
They were isolated from foreign contact

questions.answer: They enabled sea trade with western countries

questions.question: Which islands are located in the Bay of Bengal?
questions.answer: Andaman and Nicobar

questions.question: Which group of islands lies in the Arabian Sea?
questions.answer: Lakshadweep

questions.question: Which ancient manuscript mentions Indian islands?
questions.answer: Periplus of the Erythrean Sea

questions.question: Who authored the manuscript Periplus of the Erythrean Sea?
questions.answer: An unknown Greek sailor

questions.question: Which regions does the Thar Desert spread across?
questions.answer: Rajasthan, Haryana, Gujarat

questions.question: Which river marks the northern boundary of the Thar Desert?
questions.answer: Satluj

questions.question: What is the Ghaggar river called in Pakistan?
questions.answer: Hakra

questions.question: Why are many Harappan sites found along the dry course of the Ghaggar river?

options.text: The river was a trade route

questions.answer: The river once supported settlements

questions.question: Which cities are associated with the Harappan civilization?
questions.answer: Harappa and Mohen-jo-daro

questions.question: In which present-day country are Harappa and Mohen-jo-daro located?
questions.answer: Pakistan

questions.question: Which countries together form South Asia?

options.text: India, Pakistan, Nepal, Bhutan, Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, Afghanistan

questions.answer: India, Pakistan, Nepal, Bhutan, Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, Afghanistan

questions.question: Why is South Asia also referred to as the Indian subcontinent?

options.text: Due to the size and significance of India

questions.answer: Due to the size and significance of India

questions.question: Which neighboring countries are NOT part of the Indian subcontinent?
questions.answer: China and Myanmar

questions.question: Despite not being part of the subcontinent, why are China and Myanmar important?

options.text: They had cultural and trade relations with India
They were part of the Maurya Empire

questions.answer: They had cultural and trade relations with India

questions.question: Which environmental factor directly supports human livelihood?
questions.answer: Climate and rainfall

questions.question: What leads to migration of people from settlements according to the chapter?
questions.answer: Scarcity of means of living

questions.question: Which coast lies on the western side of India?
questions.answer: Konkan Coast

questions.question: Which geographical condition supported post-Harappan agrarian cultures?
questions.answer: Fertile land of Deccan Plateau

questions.question: Which factor shows the inseparable nature of history and geography?
questions.answer: Human dependence on environment

questions.question: Which region was separated from Central Asia by mountain ranges?
questions.answer: Indian subcontinent

questions.question: What role did passes in the Hindukush play in history?

options.text: They enabled entry of invaders and travelers

questions.answer: They enabled entry of invaders and travelers

questions.question: Which factor did NOT reduce the importance of sea routes?
questions.answer: Continued sea trade

questions.question: Which geographical factor influenced ancient Indian contact with foreign cultures?
questions.answer: Sea ports

questions.question: Which region emerged as the center of earliest Indian civilization?
questions.answer: Sindhu-Ganga-Brahmaputra plains

questions.question: Which river basin region supported the rise of states and empires?
questions.answer: Sindhu-Ganga region

questions.question: Which element supports the development of regional culture?
questions.answer: Flora and fauna

questions.question: Which geographical feature isolated India from Central Asia?
questions.answer: Mountain ranges

questions.question: What type of relationship exists between history and geography?
questions.answer: Very close

questions.question: Which human activity shows dependence on geographical surroundings?
questions.answer: Occupation

questions.question: Which statement best explains why geography influences history?

options.text: It shapes human life and settlements

questions.answer: It shapes human life and settlements

questions.question: Define history as explained in the chapter.
questions.answer: History is a coherent account of significant past events in the progress of human culture.

questions.question: Name the four major pillars of history.
questions.answer: Time, place, society and individuals are the four major pillars of history.

questions.question: Which pillar of history is directly related to geography?
questions.answer: The pillar of history related to geography is place.

questions.question: State one reason why geography influences human life.
questions.answer: Geography influences human life because food, clothing, housing and occupations depend on geographical conditions.

questions.question: Why is fertile land scarce in hilly regions?
questions.answer: Fertile land is scarce in hilly regions due to uneven terrain and steep slopes.

questions.question: How does the availability of fertile land affect diet?
questions.answer: The availability of fertile land determines the production of crops, which directly affects the diet of people.

questions.question: What type of food sources are common in hilly regions?
questions.answer: People in hilly regions depend more on hunting and gathering for food.

questions.question: What factors support the livelihood of people in a region?
questions.answer: Climate, rainfall, agricultural produce, flora and fauna support the livelihood of people.

questions.question: Why do human settlements flourish in certain regions?
questions.answer: Human settlements flourish where the means of living are plentiful.

questions.question: What happens to settlements when resources become scarce?
questions.answer: When resources become scarce, people leave settlements and villages or towns become deserted.

questions.question: Name two reasons that force people to abandon settlements.
questions.answer: Environmental degradation and drought force people to abandon settlements.

questions.question: State the geographical boundaries of India.
questions.answer: India is bounded by the Himalayas in the north, the Bay of Bengal in the east, the Arabian Sea in the west and the Indian Ocean in the south.

questions.question: Which regions were part of ancient India before 1947?
questions.answer: Present-day India, Pakistan and Bangladesh were part of ancient India.

questions.question: Name any two important geographical regions influencing Indian history.
questions.answer: The Himalayas and the plains of the Sindhu-Ganga-Brahmaputra rivers influenced Indian history.

questions.question: How did the Himalayas influence the Indian subcontinent?
questions.answer: The Himalayas acted as a natural barrier separating the Indian subcontinent from Central Asia.

questions.question: Name the two important mountain passes mentioned in the chapter.
questions.answer: The Khyber Pass and the Bolan Pass are the two important mountain passes.

questions.question: Why were the Khyber and Bolan passes historically important?
questions.answer: They provided land routes for trade, travelers and foreign invaders into ancient India.

questions.question: What was the Silk Route used for?
questions.answer: The Silk Route was used for trade, especially for exporting silk to western countries.

questions.question: Name the three major rivers of the northern plains.
questions.answer: The Sindhu, Ganga and Brahmaputra rivers are the three major rivers.

questions.question: Why are river basins suitable for early civilizations?
questions.answer: River basins provide fertile soil and water, supporting agriculture and settlements.

questions.question: Define a peninsula as mentioned in the chapter.
questions.answer: A peninsula is a region bounded by the sea on three sides.

questions.question: Which plateau occupies most of the Indian peninsula?
questions.answer: The Deccan Plateau occupies most of the Indian peninsula.

questions.question: Name the mountain ranges located north of the Deccan Plateau.
questions.answer: The Vindhya and Satpuda mountain ranges are located north of the Deccan Plateau.

questions.question: What is another name for the Western Ghats?
questions.answer: The Western Ghats are also known as the Sahyadri mountain ranges.

questions.question: Name the coastal regions lying west of the Sahyadri ranges.
questions.answer: The Konkan and Malabar coastal regions lie west of the Sahyadri ranges.

questions.question: Why was the Deccan Plateau important in ancient times?
questions.answer: The Deccan Plateau had fertile land where many agrarian cultures flourished.

questions.question: Which empire included the Deccan Plateau within its territory?
questions.answer: The Maurya Empire included the Deccan Plateau within its territory.

questions.question: How did coastal regions help ancient India?
questions.answer: Coastal regions helped ancient India through sea trade with western countries.

questions.question: Name the Indian islands located in the Bay of Bengal.
questions.answer: The Andaman and Nicobar Islands are located in the Bay of Bengal.

questions.question: Where is Lakshadweep located?
questions.answer: Lakshadweep is located in the Arabian Sea.

questions.question: Why were Indian islands important in ancient sea trade?
questions.answer: Their location made them important stops and reference points in ancient sea trade.

questions.question: Name the ancient text that mentions Indian islands.
questions.answer: The manuscript Periplus of the Erythrean Sea mentions Indian islands.

questions.question: Who wrote the Periplus of the Erythrean Sea?
questions.answer: It was written by an unknown Greek sailor.

questions.question: Which states does the Thar Desert spread across in India?
questions.answer: The Thar Desert spreads across Rajasthan, Haryana and parts of Gujarat.

questions.question: Which river flows to the north of the Thar Desert?
questions.answer: The Satluj river flows to the north of the Thar Desert.

questions.question: What is the Ghaggar river called in Pakistan?
questions.answer: The Ghaggar river is called Hakra in Pakistan.

questions.question: Why are Harappan sites found along the dry course of the Ghaggar river?
questions.answer: Because the river once flowed there and supported Harappan settlements.

questions.question: Name the two major cities of the Harappan civilization.
questions.answer: Harappa and Mohen-jo-daro are the two major cities.

questions.question: Where are Harappa and Mohen-jo-daro located today?
questions.answer: They are located in present-day Pakistan.

questions.question: Which countries together form South Asia?
questions.answer: India, Afghanistan, Pakistan, Nepal, Bhutan, Bangladesh and Sri Lanka form South Asia.

questions.question: Why is South Asia called the Indian subcontinent?
questions.answer: It is called the Indian subcontinent due to the size and significance of India in the region.

questions.question: Which neighboring countries are not part of the Indian subcontinent?
questions.answer: China and Myanmar are not part of the Indian subcontinent.

questions.question: Why are China and Myanmar important in ancient Indian history?
questions.answer: They had cultural and trade relations with ancient India.

questions.question: How does climate influence human lifestyle?
questions.answer: Climate influences food habits, clothing, housing and occupations.

questions.question: What role does rainfall play in human settlements?
questions.answer: Rainfall supports agriculture and ensures availability of water for settlements.

questions.question: Why is there a close relation between history and geography?
questions.answer: Because geographical conditions influence human life, settlements and historical developments.

questions.question: What happens to towns during prolonged droughts?
questions.answer: During prolonged droughts, towns may be deserted due to lack of resources.

questions.question: Name one factor that helped cultural development in regions.
questions.answer: Availability of natural resources helped cultural development in regions.

questions.question: Which geographical feature helped India maintain contact with western countries?
questions.answer: Sea routes and ports helped India maintain contact with western countries.

questions.question: State one reason why geography cannot be separated from history.
questions.answer: Geography shapes human activities and settlements which form the basis of historical events.

questions.question: Explain how geographical conditions shaped the lifestyle of early humans.
questions.answer: Geographical conditions determined the availability of food, shelter and occupations, thereby shaping the lifestyle of early humans.

questions.question: Why is place considered an essential element in writing history?
questions.answer: Place is essential because historical events occur in specific geographical settings that influence human activities.

questions.question: How did differences in terrain create differences in human occupations?
questions.answer: Different terrains offered different resources, leading people to adopt occupations suited to their surroundings.

questions.question: Explain why agriculture developed more in plains than in hilly regions.
questions.answer: Plains have fertile soil and flat land suitable for cultivation, unlike hilly regions with uneven terrain.

questions.question: How did environmental degradation affect historical settlements?
questions.answer: Environmental degradation reduced resources, forcing people to abandon settlements.

questions.question: Why did some villages and towns disappear from history?
questions.answer: They disappeared due to scarcity of resources caused by droughts, invasions or environmental degradation.

questions.question: Explain the role of the Himalayas in protecting the Indian subcontinent.
questions.answer: The Himalayas formed a natural barrier that separated the Indian subcontinent from Central Asia.

questions.question: How did mountain passes influence cultural exchange in ancient India?
questions.answer: Mountain passes allowed traders, travelers and invaders to enter India, enabling cultural exchange.

questions.question: Why were river valleys preferred locations for early civilizations?
questions.answer: River valleys provided water, fertile soil and favorable conditions for agriculture and settlements.

questions.question: How did the Sindhu-Ganga-Brahmaputra plains influence Indian history?
questions.answer: These plains supported early civilizations, states and empires due to fertile land and river systems.

questions.question: Explain why India is described as a peninsula.
questions.answer: India is described as a peninsula because it is surrounded by sea on three sides.

questions.question: How did the Deccan Plateau support political power in ancient India?
questions.answer: Its fertile land supported agriculture, enabling kingdoms and empires to flourish.

questions.question: Why did several kingdoms continue to flourish in the Deccan Plateau after the Mauryas?
questions.answer: The fertile land and strategic location allowed continued agricultural and political development.

questions.question: Explain the significance of coastal regions in India’s ancient trade.
questions.answer: Coastal regions enabled sea trade and contact with western countries.

questions.question: How did sea routes complement land routes in ancient trade?
questions.answer: Sea routes allowed large-scale trade and sustained foreign contacts even after land routes developed.

questions.question: Why did the importance of sea routes not decline over time?
questions.answer: Sea trade continued to be efficient and vital for international trade.

questions.question: Explain the role of Indian islands in ancient maritime trade.
questions.answer: Their location made them important reference points and stops in sea trade routes.

questions.question: Why is the Periplus of the Erythrean Sea important for Indian history?
questions.answer: It provides evidence of ancient sea trade and mentions Indian islands.

questions.question: How does the Thar Desert illustrate the link between geography and history?
questions.answer: Despite being a desert today, it once supported civilizations along river courses.

questions.question: Explain the historical importance of the Ghaggar river.
questions.answer: The river supported Harappan settlements before drying up.

questions.question: Why are dried river courses important for historians?
questions.answer: They help identify locations of ancient settlements and civilizations.

questions.question: How did geography determine the spread of the Harappan civilization?
questions.answer: The civilization spread along river systems that supported agriculture and trade.

questions.question: Explain why Harappa and Mohen-jo-daro are key to understanding early Indian history.
questions.answer: They represent the earliest known urban civilization in the region.

questions.question: How does the concept of South Asia help in historical studies?
questions.answer: It allows study of shared geographical and cultural history of the region.

questions.question: Why is India central to the idea of the Indian subcontinent?
questions.answer: India’s size and historical significance dominate the region.

questions.question: Explain the historical relevance of countries neighboring ancient India.
questions.answer: They maintained cultural and trade relations with ancient India.

questions.question: How did climate influence settlement patterns in ancient times?
questions.answer: Favorable climate encouraged permanent settlements and agriculture.

questions.question: Why is rainfall crucial for sustaining civilizations?
questions.answer: Rainfall ensures water supply for agriculture and daily life.

questions.question: How did flora and fauna contribute to regional cultures?
questions.answer: They provided resources for food, tools and livelihoods.

questions.question: Explain how geography influenced housing patterns.
questions.answer: Housing types depended on climate, terrain and available materials.

questions.question: Why is geography considered dynamic in historical studies?
questions.answer: Changes in environment continuously affect human life and history.

questions.question: How did invasions impact settlements historically?
questions.answer: Invasions disrupted life and forced people to migrate or abandon towns.

questions.question: Explain the interdependence between humans and their environment.
questions.answer: Humans depend on the environment for survival while modifying it over time.

questions.question: Why is geography essential for understanding historical progress?
questions.answer: It explains why civilizations developed differently in different regions.

questions.question: How does scarcity of resources change human movement?
questions.answer: Scarcity forces people to migrate in search of better living conditions.

questions.question: Explain how fertile plains contributed to political stability.
questions.answer: Agricultural surplus supported population growth and governance.

questions.question: Why did ancient trade flourish along both land and sea routes?
questions.answer: Different routes enabled wider exchange of goods and cultures.

questions.question: How did geography influence India’s contact with the western world?
questions.answer: Coastlines and sea routes enabled interaction with western countries.

questions.question: Explain the importance of studying physical maps in history.
questions.answer: Physical maps show geographical features that influenced historical events.

questions.question: Why are mountains both barriers and gateways in history?
questions.answer: They restrict movement but passes allow controlled entry.

questions.question: How did geography affect food habits in different regions?
questions.answer: Availability of resources determined whether people farmed or hunted.

questions.question: Explain how historical regions are identified through geography.
questions.answer: Geographical features define boundaries of historical regions.

questions.question: Why is the study of geography necessary for understanding civilization growth?
questions.answer: Civilization growth depends on natural resources and environment.

questions.question: How did rivers act as lifelines of ancient civilizations?
questions.answer: They provided water, fertile soil and transport routes.

questions.question: Explain how deserts influenced settlement distribution.
questions.answer: Deserts limited settlements to areas near water sources.

questions.question: Why are historical boundaries different from present political boundaries?
questions.answer: Historical boundaries were shaped by geography rather than politics.

questions.question: How did geographical unity influence cultural unity?
questions.answer: Shared geography encouraged shared cultural practices.

questions.question: Explain the role of geography in shaping trade networks.
questions.answer: Natural routes determined paths of trade and exchange.

questions.question: Why is the Indian subcontinent studied as a single historical unit?
questions.answer: It shares common geographical features and historical developments.

questions.question: Summarize the importance of geography in understanding Indian history.
questions.answer: Geography explains settlement patterns, economic activities and historical events.
